page.title: 12Village Carnival, Wombourne
page.content: On July 13th 1985, the Ounsdale Garden Party (village fete) was due to take place. However industrial action by teaching unions caused its cancellation Despite this the village went ahead with its own plans to hold a fete.There would be stalls run by local clubs and organisations, behind the Civic Centre, as well as gymnastic and dance displays to entertain the public. The highlight of the afternoon was the procession of decorated floats through the village. Much work had been done to disguise the lorries and vans and their passengers. They portrayed the theme of a "Holiday of a Lifetime". The pyramids of Egypt, the fantasy of Disneyland and the glamour of Hong Kong were featured on floats which were built by villagers associated with schools, a dance club, pubs and certain streets.
